lj.lj_ly: Denmark's victory put paid to our hopes of qualifying.

entry.def: Paid is the past tense and past participle of pay .
Paid workers, or people who do paid work, receive money for the work that they do.

example.ex: Apart from a small team of paid staff, the organisation consists of unpaid volunteers.
example.tran: 除了一小组受薪员工外，这个组织里都是不领报酬的志愿者。
禁止从事有偿工作的旅游签证

entry.def: If you are given paid holiday, you get your wages or salary even though you are not at work.

example.ex: ...10 days' paid holiday for house hunting...
example.tran: 用于找房子的10天带薪假期

example.ex: He has been placed on a paid leave of absence while investigations are made.
example.tran: 调查进行期间，单位给他放了带薪假。

entry.def: If you are well paid, you receive a lot of money for the work that you do. If you are badly paid, you do not receive much money.

example.ex: Travel and tourism employees in the UK are among the worst paid in the developed world...
example.tran: 在发达国家中，英国的旅游行业雇员报酬最低。

entry.def: If an unexpected event puts paid to someone's hopes, chances, or plans, it completely ends or destroys them.

example.ex: ...a series of airforce strikes that put paid to the General's hopes of fighting on...
example.tran: 一连串空中打击粉碎了那位将军继续战斗的希望

example.ex: Only six months ago I ran my own business. The recession put paid to that.
example.tran: 仅仅6个月前我还经营着自己的公司，经济衰退让公司关了门。

means.word_mean: 1. marked by the reception of pay;
